newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey says 29 Kurdish guerrillas dead in clashes.
newsitem.headline: Turkey says 29 Kurdish guerrillas dead in clashes.

text.p: Turkey's security forces said on Thursday they had killed 25 Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) guerrillas in fighting near the Iraqi border and four other rebels in separate clashes.
The regional governor's office in the southeastern city of Diyarbakir said the clashes had taken place in the border province of Hakkari and in Bitlis to the north. It gave no date.
More than 100 people died in two days of fighting between Turkish troops and Kurdish guerrillas that spilled just across the border into northern Iraq earlier this week.
A high-ranking security official said troops had entered Iraqi territory in the earlier fighting in pinprick raids but had later withdrawn.
More than 22,000 people have died in 12 years of conflict between troops and the PKK, fighting for Kurdish self rule in southeast Turkey.
